script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Good morning! I'm Dr. Martinez. How are we doing today for our routine pediatric health maintenance visit?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Hi, we're doing okay. This is Emma's four-year checkup.

script.speaker: child
script.text: I don't want any shots today!

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Well hello Emma! We'll see about immunizations based on your current vaccination schedule and catch-up requirements. Any acute concerns or interval changes in her overall health status?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Um, what do you mean by interval changes? She's been pretty healthy, but I've been worried about her eating habits lately.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: I'm referring to any significant health events since her last visit. Regarding her nutritional intake patterns - can you elaborate on the specific dietary concerns?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: She's become really picky about food. She used to eat everything, now she only wants chicken nuggets and crackers.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: That's quite common for this developmental stage. We call this physiologic anorexia of early childhood combined with neophobia. Let me assess her anthropometric measurements first.

script.speaker: child
script.text: What's that big word mean?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Yes, I'd like to know what that means too.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: It means it's normal for kids her age to be afraid of new foods and eat less. Emma, can you step on this scale for me?

script.speaker: child
script.text: Okay, but I'm not heavy!

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Her growth parameters are tracking along the 60th percentile for both height and weight, with appropriate BMI percentile maintenance.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Is that good? I don't understand percentiles very well.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Yes, that indicates normal linear growth velocity and weight gain trajectory. Now let me perform a comprehensive physical examination. Emma, can you say 'ahh' for me?

script.speaker: child
script.text: Ahhhhh! Do I have bugs in my throat?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: No bugs! Your oropharynx appears normal with no erythema or exudate. Let me auscultate your heart and lungs now.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: What does that mean - the eryth-whatever you said?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Sorry - no redness or infection in her throat. Heart rate is regular with no murmurs, gallops, or rubs. Pulmonary fields are clear bilaterally.

script.speaker: child
script.text: That's cold! Why do you have to listen to me?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: I'm making sure your heart and lungs are working perfectly! Her neurological assessment shows age-appropriate gross and fine motor development with normal deep tendon reflexes.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: She's been having some tantrums lately. Is that normal for her age?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Absolutely. That's typical for her developmental stage as she's establishing autonomy while lacking full executive function capabilities for emotional regulation.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: I'm sorry, can you explain that in simpler terms?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: She's learning to be independent but doesn't have all the skills to handle big feelings yet. It's completely normal. Now, regarding immunizations, she needs her DTaP, IPV, MMR, and varicella boosters today.

script.speaker: child
script.text: I don't want shots! Will they hurt?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: They might pinch a little, but it's very quick. These vaccines will help keep you healthy and prevent serious communicable diseases.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: How many shots is that exactly? And what diseases do they prevent?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Four immunizations total. They protect against diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, polio, measles, mumps, rubella, and chickenpox - all potentially serious pediatric infectious diseases.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Okay, that makes sense. What about the eating issues we discussed?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Continue offering varied foods without pressuring. Her growth parameters are adequate, so this feeding behavior shouldn't cause nutritional deficiencies. Any other questions?

script.speaker: child
script.text: Can I have a sticker when we're done?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Absolutely! You've been such a good patient today. I'll see you back in a year for your five-year health maintenance visit.
